refnamediv.refpurpose: Fetches all rows of result data into an array

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: oci_fetch_all fetches all the rows from a result into a user-defined array. oci_fetch_all returns the number of rows fetched or &false; in case of error. skip is the number of initial rows to ignore when fetching the result (default value of 0, to start at the first line). maxrows is the number of rows to read, starting at the skipth row (default to -1, meaning all the rows).

Parameter flags can be any combination of the following:
OCI_FETCHSTATEMENT_BY_ROW
OCI_FETCHSTATEMENT_BY_COLUMN (default value)
OCI_NUM
OCI_ASSOC

note.para: In PHP versions before 5.0.0 you must use ocifetchstatement instead. This name still can be used, it was left as alias of oci_fetch_all for downwards compatability. This, however, is deprecated and not recommended.
